data.title: Let Us Remember
data.text:
The New York Annual Conference

News

Let Us Remember

Let Us Remember

Reverend Hilda Maud Graham

4/4/2024

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Hilda Maud Graham, 96 of Peekskill, NY who passed away on Thursday, April 4, 2024. Reverend Hilda Maud Graham was born July 2, 1928, to Charles and Eliza Rose of Claremont, St. Ann, Jamaica, West Indies. She was educated in the Jamaica Public School System and graduated at the 3rd Jamaica Local Level. Immediately after graduation, she began working for the Browns Family Business Enterprise and the Claremont PC Bank. As a member of ...

Mrs. Johnnie Miller

3/21/2024

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Johnnie Miller, 98, who died on Thursday, March 21, 2024 in Cape Coral, FL. Johnnie was the widow of Rev. Dr. Arnold Miller who served in the conference until his retirement in 1990. Rev. Miller died in 2016. Johnnie was born on June 20, 1925 in Scotland, Arkansas, the youngest daughter of a machinist. She had one sister and three brothers, who all predeceased her. Johnnie graduated from Massey Business College in Houston with a ...

Reverend Phyllis J. Kellam Skidmore

3/19/2024

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Phyllis J. Kellam Skidmore, 90, of Greenville, NY, who passed away on Tuesday, March 19, 2024 at Hudson Park Nursing Home in Albany, NY. She was born on August 29, 1933, in Catskill to the late Clinton and Rose (Mickel) Kellam and was the last child of seven brothers and sisters, all who predeceased her. She was a graduate of SUNY Cobleskill, Western Connecticut University, Wesley Seminary, and SUNY Potsdam. In 1958 she married ...

Reverend Kathryn "Bebe" Loizeaux

3/15/2024

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Kathryn “Bebe” Loizeaux, 93, of Beaverkill, NY who passed away on Friday, March 15, 2024. Kathryn, "Bebe" as she was known, was born and raised in Reading, PA, to parents Paul Butler and Sarah Oxenrider Butler. She went to college at East Stroudsburg State. Bebe met Tim Loizeaux in Roscoe, NY, marrying in 1950 and joining him in his roles in the service to our country. She lived in Plainfield, NJ for 20 years where she was a ...

Mrs. Asta Terwilliger

3/9/2024

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Asta Terwilliger, 89 who died on Saturday, March 9, 2024. Asta was the widow of Rev. Irving Terwilliger who served in the New York Conference for 30 years pastoring Fleischmanns, Grand Gorge, Olivebridge and Center Moriches. He died in 1998. The only one of her family born in a hospital, a novelty at that time, Asta was born on August 24, 1934 in Greenport, NY. She grew up in eastern Long Island and Connecticut when her family moved to ...

Reverend Lloyd Sanborn "Sandy" Van Norden

3/6/2024

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Lloyd Sanborn “Sandy” Van Norden, 84 of Grantham, NH who passed away on Wednesday, March 6, 2024 He was born April 20, 1939 in Hanover, New Hampshire, the first child of Clark and Maud (Sanborn) Van Norden. As a child, Sandy lived in Massachusetts and Vermont, graduating from Thetford Academy in 1957. After graduation he enlisted in the United States Air Force, where he served for four years before attending college. He earned ...

Rev. Dr. Vera Yvonne Jermin Annum

2/20/2024

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Dr. Vera Yvonne Jermin Annum, 81 of the Bronx, NY by way of Aruba in the Netherland Antilles, who passed away Tuesday, February 20, 2024, at home with her family in Lawrenceville, GA following a long battle with dementia. Vera was born December 26, 1943, on the island of Aruba in the Netherland Antilles and is the late Israel and Muriel Jermin’s 3rd daughter of 9 children. At the tender age of 13, under the tutelage of her ...

Mrs.Shirley M. Hunter

2/15/2024

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Shirley M. Hunter of Kingston, NY who died on Thursday, February 15, 2024. Shirley was the widow of Rev. William H. Hunter, OSL who died in 2011. Shirley was the daughter Rev. W. Stanley Risch and Ethel E. Floughton. From birth they encouraged Shirley in her faith. A preacher’s daughter, Shirley grew up in parsonages throughout New York State. She graduated from Pine Bush Central High School, where she was awarded the "Service Above ...

The Reverend Robert "Bob" R. Hubbard

1/17/2024

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Robert “Bob” R. Hubbard, 86, of Tequesta, FL who died on Wednesday, January 17, 2024 after a brief illness. He is the spouse of Rev. Dr. Marion Hubbard who retired from NYC in 2018. Bob was born on May 13, 1937 to George and Francese (Rowan) Hubbard in Erie, PA. Bob was a graduate of the Ohio State University and George Washington Law School. He worked as a Patent Attorney for several firms including RCA, Mohawk Data Sciences Corp., ...

The Reverend Ralph E Darmstadt

1/8/2024

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Ralph E. Darmstadt, 93 of Fleischmanns and most recently Saugerties, NY who died Monday, January 8, 2024 at Health Alliance Hospital in Kingston, NY following a massive stroke. Ralph was born February 20, 1930 in Lynbrook, NY son of the late Emile and Carrie Mae Hendrickson Darmstadt. At age 26, while working at a gardening supply store and nursery, he was "struck by the revelation" that his life would follow a unique path. He was...

Reverend Alexis Anne Carol

1/7/2024

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Alexis Anne Carol, 74, of Lake Tahoe, NV who passed away peacefully on Sunday, January 7, 2024. Alexis was born on September 13, 1949 in New Haven, CT and held precious memories of growing up by the ocean in Morris Cove with her extended Italian-Sicilian family, as the daughter of Carolyn Rascati (Girardi) and Alexander Rascati. Alexis earned her undergraduate degree from Albertus Magnus College and graduate degrees from Yale ...

The Reverend Gry Brent Betts

12/7/2023

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Gary Brent Betts, 83 of Versailles, KY who passed away at his home on Thursday, December 7, 2023. Gary was born March 12, 1940, in Millersburg, KY to Gordon Willis and Ruby Davis Betts. He attended the Millersburg Military Institute in Millersburg, KY and spent summers along the Kentucky River at Kamp Kaydet (Woodford County). A graduate of Southern Methodist University and Perkins School of Theology, he was an ordained Methodist ...

The Reverend Donald H Kirkham

12/4/2023

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Donald H. Kirkham, 85 of Stratford, CT who died away on Monday, December 4, 2023 of complications of Lewy Body Dementia. Born in 1938 to the late Phillip and Mary Anne Kirkham in Sydney, Australia, Don was educated at Fort Street Boys’ High School, Bathurst Teachers’ College, and the University of Sydney. He taught elementary school and worked for the Commonwealth Office of Education. In 1966, Don came to the United States to...

The Reverend Harold "Hal" Vink

11/30/2023

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Harold “Hal” Van Wely Vink, 90, who peacefully passed into the loving arms of his Lord Jesus Christ surrounded by his family on Thursday, November 30, 2023 after suffering a stroke. Known as Hal since his college days, he was born on September 15, 1933, to Gertrude, at home in Carmel, NY, birthed by his father, Dr. Garrett Vink. In addition to attending schools in Carmel, Hal also went to the St. Thomas Boy’s Choir School in ...

Reverend John Thomas

10/9/2023

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. John Thomas, 78 of Lexington, VA who passed away peacefully on Monday, October 9, 2023 surrounded by his wife and loving family. John was born on December 4, 1944, in Oakland, California, to Navy Chaplain George Earl Thomas Sr., and violinist Carmel Madeline (Desantis) Thomas, John credited their 17 moves, courtesy of the U.S. Navy, with his ability to connect easily and genuinely with others. He proudly identified as a “Navy ...

Reverend Robert John Cave

9/23/2023

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Robert John Cave, 90, who died on Monday, September 23, 2023. He was born in Manhattan in 1933 and was raised in South Aqueduct and Richmond Hills, Queens. Robert received a BA from Long Island University, a MDiv. from Drew University and a Master of Theology from Princeton Theological Seminary. He served in active duty in the Marine Corps during the Korean War from 1950 -1952, During his life he had a variety of jobs. He worked ...

Pauline Carolyn "Polly" Gangaware

9/18/2023

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Pauline Carolyn “Polly” Gangaware, 76, who died on Monday, September 18, 2023 at Hartford Healthcare Center, Winsted CT. Polly is the wife of Pastor Lee Darryl Gangaware. Polly and Pastor Lee celebrated their 53rd wedding Anniversary on August 29, 2023. They were wed on August 29, 1970 at Trinity Wesleyan Church in Allentown, PA. Polly was born January 27, 1947 in Easton, MD daughter of the late Paul Fletcher and Hannah (Ellwanger) ...

Reverend Elizabeth "Betty" Johnson

9/13/2023

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Elizabeth “Betty” Johnson, 93, of Waldwick, NY who died peacefully at home on Wednesday, September 13, 2023. She was the widow of Rev. Emmett B. Johnson who served in the NYAC. He died in 2020. Elizabeth Louise Schumann was born April 17, 1930, to Charles W. Schumann and Elsie Toni (Heyssig) Schumann. The family lived in Teaneck, NJ and she graduated from Teaneck High School. Elizabeth and Emmett met on a blind date. It was love at ...

Reverend Robert L. R. Hankins

9/8/2023

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Robert L.R. Hankins, 88, of Whiteville, NC who passed away peacefully at home on Friday, September 8, 2023. Robert was licensed to preach in the Holston Conference in 1954. He was ordained Deacon in 1960 and Elder in 1962, both in the New York Conference. Robert served churches in Rhinecliff and Rhinebeck, Naugatuck, and Buchanan: Trinity Boscobel. He retired in June 1999. His influence, wit, wisdom, compassion, incredible patience,...

Reverend John A. Carr

9/5/2023

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. John A. Carr, 91, of Wallingford, CT who passed away peacefully at his home in the company of his beloved wife, Maggie, on Tuesday, September 5, 2023. He was born in Carbondale, PA, in the middle of a spring blizzard, to Alden and Isabella Carr. He spent his early childhood in Lake Como, PA, then Hancock and Hunter, NY. At age 10 John moved to Derby CT where he began his life-long involvement in both scouting and Methodism . ...

Dorothy Winifred "Winnie" Liberatore

9/3/2023

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Dorothy Winifred “Winnie” Liberatore, 93 of Catskill, NY who died on Sunday, September 3, 2023 at the home of her daughter in Greenwich, NY. Winnie is the widow of Rev. Alfred Liberatore who died in 2011. Winnie was born on March 9, 1930, in Katonah, NY at her grandmother's house. She was the daughter of Percy and Dorothy (Knapp) Waters of Stamford, CT where she spent her childhood exploring the woods with her sister and neighborhood ...

Jacqueline Donna Haaf

8/31/2023

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Jacqueline Donna Haaf, 95 who died on Thursday, August 31, 2023. Jacquie was the widow of Rev. Eugene Haaf who served in the conference for 37 years. Rev. Haaf died in March 2023. She came into this world, with her infectious smile, on May 24, 1928 in Pittsburgh, PA. Jacquie began exploring the world right away - traveling home to Columbus, Ohio with her mother, Dorothy, and beloved Aunt Peg, then on to New York City where she grew up ...

Reverend Robert "Bob" Johnson

8/28/2023

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Robert Temple “Bob” Johnson 88, of Farmington, CT who passed away peacefully on Monday, August 28, 2023. As the son of Arvid Oscar, “Swanny” Johnson and Edith Alyce Temple, Bob enjoyed an idyllic childhood and great closeness with his extended family, spending much precious time with his sister Barbara, aunts, uncle, cousins and grandmother. Bob could be found hopping ice flows across the Allegheny River or running amok through the ...

Elizabeth "Betty" Dunlap

8/23/2023

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Elizabeth “Betty” Mary Jordan Dunlap, 97, of East Moriches, NY who died on Wednesday, August 23, 2023 at East End Hospice, Quogue, NY. Betty is the widow of NYAC clergy Rev Loyd Wayne Dunlap and the mother of retired clergy Rev. Larry Dunlap She was born April 14, 1926 in Cape May, NJ. The daughter of Commander USCG Chester Lawrence Jordan and Clara Irene Harris Jordan. She was raised in New Jersey, Virginia, Maryland and ...

Reverend Robert "Bob" Osgood

8/22/2023

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Robert “Bob” Emory Osgood, 83 of Pittston, PA who passed away on Tuesday, August 22, 2023. In recent months he battled cancer and congestive heart failure, He passed away two weeks after his 83rd birthday and 9 days before his 60th wedding anniversary to the love of his life, Nancy. Bob was born on August 7, 1940, to Lucy Rogers Osgood and Arthur Baxter Osgood of Plainville, Connecticut. He developed a long friendship with Nancy ...

Reverend Maybelle Edna Renzi

8/11/2023

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Maybelle Edna Renzi, of Pasadena, CA who passed away on Friday, August 11, 2023. Maybelle suffered for many years from Alzheimer’s disease and was in a nursing home in California near her son Burt. During Covid she was not allowed any visitors. Her son said she deteriorated greatly during that time. Maybelle was licensed to preach in the New York Conference in 1994 and became an Associate Member in 2000. Her pastoral churches all in...

The Reverend Martha "Marty" Morrison

6/27/2023

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Martha “Marty” Virginia Morrison, 92, of Concord, MA who passed away on Tuesday, June 27, 2023 with her family around her at the Care Dimensions Hospice House of Lincoln, MA. Born in Charleston, West Virginia on April 6, 1931, Martha or Marty as she was known, was raised primarily by her mother, Clyde Bailey, a registered nurse, as her father, Estel, was killed in a motorway accident when Marty was 6 years old. As a young girl, ...

Carolyn Hardin Engelhardt

6/18/2023

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Carolyn Hardin Engelhardt, 79, of Bloomfield, CT who died on Sunday, June 18, 2023. She was married for over 53 years to the late Rev. George Christian Engelhardt. George was a member of the New York Conference from 1967 until his death in 2021. Carolyn was born on May 10, 1944 in Memphis, TN, daughter of the late Melvin Loyd Hardin and Helen Harriet Hardin (Morrison). Carolyn grew up in Arkansas and remained very tied to her Southern ...

Robert "Bob" Miller

6/10/2023

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Robert Miller, 86, who died on Saturday, June 10, 2023. Robert was NYAC Conference Secretary from 2007 – 2010. Robert, Bob, Miller was born on November 1, 1936. He moved to Bradenton, FL when he was 3 years old. He attended Manatee High School and graduated from Georgia Tech with a degree in Chemical Engineering. This jump started his lifelong career of working for Exxon Corporation. He became President of Exxon, in Japan. He always...

Margaret Ruth Bormolini-Lanham

6/9/2023

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Margaret Ruth Bormolini-Lanham, 98 who died peacefully at her residence at Apple Rehab on Friday, June 9, 2023 after a short illness. Margaret was the widow of Rev. Charles W. Lanham who served in the New York Conference retiring in 1987. Born April 18, 1925 in Watertown, CT, Margaret was the daughter of Raymond J. and Hazel (Williams) Black. She had lived most of her early life in the Watertown area working as a Bookkeeper. ...

Wilbert "Wil" Hicks

6/2/2023

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Wilbert (Wil) Alphonso Hicks, 71, of New Rochelle, NY who died on Friday, June 2, 2023 after a long illness. He was the husband of Rev. Dr. Peola Hicks forty-seven years. Wilbert Alphonso (Fonz) was born October 5,1951, and raised in Stuart, Virginia. He was the son of the late Henry Nelson and Mary Lucille (London) Hicks. Wilbert learned his work ethic very early having worked alongside both his mother and father. At a young age ...

The Reverend Gale Holger Hansen

5/27/2023

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Gale Holger “Hogie” Hansen, 86, of Newtown Square, PA who passed away on Saturday, May 27, 2023. Rev. Hansen was ordained a Full Elder in 1964. He pastored Seymour: Great Hill and Oxford. He spent most of his career in extension Ministries: Assistant Director of Ministry in National Parks, NCCC; Director of Alumni Relations, Earlham College; Associate Director of Development, Earlham College; Associate VP Swarthmore College; VP for...

The Reverend Bruce Younkin

4/29/2023

April 29, 2023 Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Bruce Younkin, 76, of Flat Rock, NC who passed away on Saturday, April 29, 2023. Bruce received a B.A. from Franklin & Marshall College, a M.Div. from Union Seminary in New York City, and a MSW from Yeshiva University. He also spent a year at Oxford University studying Old Testament. He was a Clergy in the New York Annual Conference of the United Methodist Church from 1973 until 2006. From 1973 to 1996 he served the ...

The Reverend James Woodrow Cook

4/25/2023

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. James Woodrow Cook, 94 who passed away on Tuesday, April 25, 2023 at EC Campus of United Methodist Homes, Binghamton, NY. Jim was born March 10, 1929, to William Lee and Ila Jackson Cook in Bluefield, West Virginia and grew up in Dublin, Virginia. He graduated from Dublin High School in 1947, and served four years in the US Navy from 1948 -1952, as an Aviation Metalsmith 3rd Class, in San Diego, CA and Atsugi, Japan during the ...

The Reverend Anne Bracket

4/18/2023

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Anne-Marie Bracket, 65 of Safety Harbor, FL who passed away unexpectedly at her home on Tuesday, April 18, 2023. Anne was born in Bristol, CT to the late Vernon M. Bracket and Glenna (Sweet) and predeceased by a brother Jimmy. Anne was a longtime member of the United Methodist Church in Hartford, CT and was ordained an Elder in June 2002. Anne served the following churches in the New York Conference: Rocky Hill UMC, Hamden ...

Mr. James "Jim" Bickerton

4/2/2023

April 2, 2023 Over the years we have held Bishop Bickerton’s father in our prayers. It is with sorrow that we inform you that “Jim” has entered the church triumphant. Let us remember the life and ministry of James “Jim” Bickerton, 87 of Palmetto, FL who passed away Sunday, April 2, 2023 at Manatee Memorial Hospital in Bradenton, FL. Jim was born December 9, 1935 in Moundsville, WV, the son of the late Orville and Wanda Purdy Bickerton. He was a retired glass mold maker from Fostoria Glass ...

The Reverend Dr. T. Anne Daniel

3/28/2023

March 28, 2023 Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Dr. T. Anne Daniel, 69, of Chauncey, NH on March 28, 2023. T. Anne came to the New York Conference from the Methodist Church in the Caribbean and the Americas. She served Manhattan: Madison Ave. UMC and Bronx: Wakefield Grace UMC. T. Anne retired at the June 2020 Annual Conference. She leaves to mourn her husband Sydney Daniel of Vermont, St. Vincent, her sons Ansyd and Alister Daniel and their wives Praise and ...

The Reverend Eugene Henry Haaf

3/23/2023

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Eugene Henry Haaf, 96, who passed away just two weeks shy of his 97th birthday (April 5), on March 23, 2023. He still sported a generous amount of black hair, recalling the little boy from D Street, Derby, who loved his mother's liver soup ("Why don't you make that anymore, Ma?" "Oh, 'Gene, it was the Depression! Liver was all we could afford!"). The little boy was just a teenager when WWII brought the draft. He served in the ...

Mr. Carlos E. Ibarra

3/11/2023

March 11, 2023 Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Carlos E Ibarra, 90, of Cobleskill, NY who died on Saturday, March 11, 2023. He is the widower of Rev. Barbara J. Ibarra who died in October 2021. Carlos was born in Salta, Argentina, on January 16, 1933. He was the son of Luis Alberto Ibarra and Mercedes Fernandez de Ibarra. As a boy, Carlos worked beside his dad in the family bicycle shop where he learned the value of hard work, which would serve him well through ...

Reverend Billy Vestal

3/1/2023

March 1, 2023 Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Billy Guy Vestal, 94 of Penny Farms, FL who passed away on Wednesday, March 1, 2023. Billy was born on July 21, 1928 in Abingdon, Virginia to Eugene Clark, Sr. and Ollie Pearl (Kestner) Vestal. Rev. Vestal graduated from Emory and Henry College in Virginia and received an M.Div from Drew University. Billy served his country in the United States Air Force. He received his License to Preach on June 10, 1951 in the ...

The Reverend Walter C Barton, Jr

2/19/2023

February 19, 2023 Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Walter C Barton, Jr, 73, who passed away on Wednesday, Sunday, February 19, 2023. Walter was born on December 22, 1949 in Lynn, Massachusetts. He was the oldest of four children born to Walter Clyde Barton, Sr. and Amy Lee (Cook) Barton. Walter graduated from Boston English High School in 1967. He graduated from Springfield College, in 1971, with a degree in psychology. In 1973 he graduated with a Masters in ...

Doris Kearsley Brooks

1/26/2023

January 26, 2023 Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Doris Kearsley Brooks 91, who died on Thursday, January 26, 2023. Doris was the widow of Rev. Elemit Brooks who served in the New York Conference. Among the churches he pastored were St Albans: Grace, Brooklyn: Union and Jamaica: Brooks Memorial. Rev. Brooks retired in 1995 and died in 2010. As of this time there is no obituary for Doris. We will update this Let Us Remember as we receive more information about Doris. ...

The Reverend Robert C Schrock

12/29/2022

December 29, 2022 Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Robert C. Schrock, 95, of Cincinnati, Ohio who passed away peacefully in his sleep on Thursday, December 29, 2022. Robert was licensed to preach in 1947 in the North East Ohio Conference. He transferred to the New York Conference in 1955 and served the following New York churches: First UMC in Brewster, NY; St. Paul and St. Andrew in Manhattan; and Pound Ridge and Vista UMCs in NY. Rev. Schrock retired in 1978. ...

The Reverend David C. Houston

12/27/2022

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. David C. Houston, 88, who passed away on Tuesday, December 27, 2022 at Vassar Brothers Hospital in Poughkeepsie, NY. David was born in Bronxville, NY to Margaret C. and Ralph M. Houston. He was joined several years later by a sister, Susan M. Houston (Judy Kaplan). Pastor Houston graduated from Hebron Academy, West Virginian Wesleyan College and Garret Theological Seminary of Northwestern University. He was licensed to preach in ...

Mrs. Marian Bundy Taylor

12/6/2022

12/6/2022 Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Marian Bundy Taylor, 100, who died on Tuesday, December 6, 2022 in Shelton, CT. She is the widow of Rev. Lyman “Bud” Taylor. Marian celebrated her 100th birthday with family and friends on Saturday, March 26, 2022 at the Wicke Health Care Center in Shelton, CT. According to her friends she was looking forward to this celebration and talked often about reaching “100 years!” According to her son, Larry Taylor, the Shelton ...

The Reverend Susumu Ando

12/6/2022

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Susumu Ando, 70, who entered his eternal Home peacefully in Allentown, PA, on December 6, 2022. Susumu was born on May 26, 1952, to Minoru and Kazuko Ando in Nagoya, Japan. He graduated from Musashino Art University in Tokyo, Japan, as a design major. In 1979 he came to the United States to study at Pratt Institute in Brooklyn, New York where he received the Master of Fine Art in oil painting. Following a job for practical ...

The Reverend Edward Lee Eastman III (Ned)

12/3/2022

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Edward Lee Eastman III (Ned), 93, of Oneonta, NY who passed away peacefully on Saturday, December 3, 2022 at his home. He was born on August 15, 1929 to Edward L. Eastman, Jr. and Alice Dodge Eastman in Elmira, NY. Ned attended Wesleyan University in CT where he earned a BA in philosophy in 1951. He then received an MDiv at the Union Theological Seminary in NYC in 1954. Ned married Jane Elizabeth Gruver on January 28, 1956, at the...

The Reverend Jane Alice Sibley

11/28/2022

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Rev. Jane Alice (McCulloch) Sibley, 77, who passed away peacefully on Monday, November 28, 2022. She was the beloved wife of Robert F. Sibley (Bob) for 57 years. She was born in Buffalo, NY, on August 21, 1945, to the late Herbert G. and Margaret (Leonard) McCulloch. She graduated from Andrew Warde H.S. in Fairfield, CT in 1963. In 1965 she and Bob married and raised their three sons in Easton, CT, their home for 33 years. A longtime ...

Angelo "Mickey" Chupungco

11/20/2022

Let us remember with thanksgiving the life and ministry of Angelo Santos Chupungco, known as “Mikey” amongst his closest friends, of Pleasantville, NY who died on Sunday, November 20, 2022. He was born on April 20,1975 in Pasig, Manila, Philippines to Aida Chupungco. Angelo, “Mikey” is survived by his wife, Rev. Susan Chupungco. He graduated from Hofstra University and was a life-long public servant. Angelo was the owner and operator of Public Safety Training Institute, LLC and a member of ...
